title: Leadership favoritism and lack of accountability overshadow good people
pros: There are many talented and hardworking employees at the mid and staff levels who genuinely care about clients and take pride in their work. Some flexibility and exposure to diverse projects can make for good experience early on.
cons: Unfortunately, the culture at Omega Healthcare is heavily influenced by favoritism and internal hierarchy rather than performance or integrity. Leadership tends to favor certain groups and backgrounds, creating a clear divide between those in the “inner circle” and everyone else. This dynamic leaves many employees — especially those outside the preferred group — feeling silenced or marginalized. I also experienced inconsistency in compensation practices, particularly around commissions and plan changes. When concerns were raised, they were met with defensiveness instead of accountability. Over time, this culture of avoidance and selective enforcement eroded trust and morale across the team.

cons: *hard to take PTO *working holidays *not great benefits *no part-time jobs *I was first hired when the company was Himagine Solutions and we had more online meetings with the leaders so we knew what was happening, when Omega took over it was harder to find out what was going on; it all seemed to be more about growing the company into a trillion dollar business. *IT hard to deal with *You have to buy your own laptop and monitor

cons: None that I can think of.

title: Great place to start
pros: No micro management, great pay
cons: Must request PTO 30 day in advance at all times (not realistic), poor management organization, poor benefits.

title: Good company
pros: I can work from home
cons: Communication is an issue sometimes

title: Great pay, but poor communication within the organization
pros: They offered great pay and it was an experience to know what I need to focus on in my career. It was very difficult to maintain the hours they promised me as a FTE due to the lack of work. They were also very quick to hire me once they learned I wanted to be a FTE and was looking for those types of hours.
cons: They had very poor communication within the team. I felt like I was constantly sending emails to HR to find out what my options were to try to resolve the lack of communication. Since I was a HCC coder who was at the end of the cycle they had very poor communication about end of contracts with clients so there was a lot of shifting us around since there was a loss of work with various clients with very poor management. I was hired on to just to be moved around with little to no explanation of the expectation of the contract and then let go after a few months thinking I had job security again with little communication. I had to provide my own equipment (computer, extra monitor & encoder) at my own expense. The training for the contract was nonexistent and when asked I about it I was told that everyone there should already know how to code so it was not necessary. You will quite literally be thrown into the position.

title: Not a serious organization
pros: Omega shuffles their employees around a lot. Which is one of the things I don't appreciate about them, but at least they're good at it. If one contract runs out of work they're good about shifting you over to a new one pretty quick.
cons: A lot to say here. My experience at Omega was limited, and for good reason. The career opportunities could be pretty good, if you can get past multiple audits. The auditing system seemed really inconsistent to me. Things that would be unmentioned in one audit could sink you in the same account type on the next audit, and I never got an explanation as to why this seemed so erratic. When the standard for accuracy is so high, I should at least be able to get an answer on why something is graded a certain way so that I can learn for next time. But none of the auditors or managers seemed to want to actually talk about the audits. One of my audits got covid guidelines concerning Z11.52 and Z20.822 flat out wrong, which I knew for a fact and still no one wanted to listen, to them it was just another score to rush through. I had to practically beg them to stop for a moment and listen to me so that we could talk, and eventually the score was reversed. Managers were probably the worst part of the experience, they're more interested in playing mind games than helping their employees succeed. The culture is very poor. I actually lost a contract here because a manager felt that it would be a better use of her time to investigate my daily actions for two weeks than to just tell me that I was doing poorly, and of course by the time she decided to tell me, the corrective action that I took didn't matter because my contract could not be salvaged. I was essentially railroaded and hung out to dry by an immature manager who wasn't willing to meet the demands for professionalism she made of her staff. However, to Omega's credit, once I told them what had happened they did find me a new contract fairly quickly. If you sign on here, always ask questions, be annoying if you have to, because it's entirely on your head if you don't know something. If a lower level manager assigns you something special make sure it's cleared with one of the upper level managers because the manager to manager communication is questionable. Moving on, there were other relatively smaller things. In the two and a half years I worked at Omega, I never once managed to get in contact with the HR department, and I tried by Outlook, Teams, and phone. I can't even verify they have an HR department because I never once talked to them. There is no live coding education or support system in place. All coding questions need to be routed to your manager, and who knows if they'll have the time or interest that day. IT can be pretty hard to work with. I had an issue where Outlook emails from my contractor were not always reaching me, which is obviously a pretty serious issue, and that was just something I had to work around because IT never provided a fix. I was expected to have Outlook and Teams on my phone so that I could reply even when I was off the clock or on lunch break. It was nearly impossible to stay at one contract for long just because the contractors kept bringing on too many people, and I would have appreciated more stability. Omega does not even provide all the equipment you need, you're expected to furnish some of that on your own. I had to buy a computer and two monitors for my very first contract with Omega. With later contracts a laptop was actually furnished for me and I'm not sure what the difference was. It may be non-Optum versus Optum contracts. But this was extremely expensive, and the Omega recruiter who first contacted me told me he could provide me a bonus to help offset the cost. What he did not tell me was that the bonus was performance based, which of course wasn't possible after I lost that one contract. This was obviously not a great experience and my mental health suffered greatly, I would not apply here again unless I had zero other options.

title: Part Time IP Coder
pros: Excellent pay. Top dollar of our industry.
cons: EHR or encoder down, not paid for this time and time must be made up outside of your schedule hours of availability that is mandatorily sent to management each week prior to the following work week. PTO can and will be denied even if following company policy/requesting even further in advance than policy requires. Things that were considered educational findings on audits in my past (findings not affecting DRG, unrelated Z codes) were counted as points deducted repeatedly. Lots and lots of incorrect audit findings (not paid for excess time reviewing the audit) sometimes would agree and other times auditors do not budge even when supported by research and other auditors agreeing with coder. Management may also agree with coder but the findings/audit score will not change. Management seemed as frustrated with auditing as coders. Because of this and constant changing between facilities, productivity and accuracy are not obtainable.

title: What a nightmare this company is!
pros: I can't think of one good thing.
cons: Recruiter just strings you along forever, telling you to not go outside of him to look for other work and to not worry, that there is plenty of work to be had. Typical salesman. Tell them anything they want to hear, as long as you get their business. Onboarding process was a nightmare and if you want help from your supervisor, you're screwed. Three weeks after being hired, I was let go and told I was done with Omega because I couldn't get my coding productivity up to 95%. When in reality, it was my questions about their timecard process and onboarding process was just too much to deal with when they mass hired at the time I was brought on. This was news to me as it wasn't what my recruiter said, but my coding supervisor said I was brought on as "seasonal". When you show them where their coding process is missing information, they never apologize. In fact, it's somehow your fault. They are very good at making your feel like a small fish in a big sea, and my coding manager was definitely on a huge power trip and seemed to enjoy emailing me with a verbal warning on day seven of my employment. It's pretty obvious that they do try to weed you out during the onboarding process. I now realize that I 'd rather not work with a company that treats their new employees so horribly. Good riddance!

title: Run!!
pros: Being able to work from home
cons: Micromanagement is bad here. The supervisors also will lie straight to your face. Will say something one week, and the next week say they never said that even with multiple witnesses. No appreciation or care for their employees, benefits are not good and are too expensive. They also give short notice of mass layoffs. They will use you until they have no use for you anymore. It's a production based job and all they care about are numbers. You are lucky to be able to use the restroom since they reprimand you for time gaps. Just a horrible place to work. I would not recommend this job.

title: Company theft
pros: You can set your own hours after passing their prebill stage
cons: Training of Salesforce is a 0, when it's ultimately the only way to show you are working. I was told to enter chart information as I'm working a chart. Ok, did that. But what I wasn't told was that if I ever leave my chair ( breaks, getting coffee, going to the bathroom, stretching, client meetings, logging on into Epic & all the other 10 items i had to log into. .. anything), that I had to enter it in Salesforce right where I am to enter the mrn. I didn't do that for 2 weeks; I was not informed to do so. And if management told me they weren't going to pay me for those times, I would have simply made it up during that week. Management told they randomly select employees and run a report showing what was worked, how long & if their are blank spots of production. Those "blank spots" are totalled up & you must subtract that from your timesheet. They of course tell you this the following week. If you do not subtract the time they are demanding, then your pay for that entire week is held hostage. You have to lie about the hours you put in for omega. It's highly unethical & although I'm not a lawyer, sounds criminal. They're bullies who are obviously unsupportive of their employees.

title: Professional & Recruiter-Friendly
pros: Strong Training & Learning Environment Omega provides excellent onboarding and continuous training in US healthcare, RCM, and insurance processes, helping freshers and professionals build strong technical and communication skills. Supportive Team & Work Culture The work environment encourages team collaboration, mentorship, and skill development, making it easier to grow confidence in handling US client interactions and claim resolution. Career Growth Opportunities Omega offers clear career pathways, allowing AR Callers to advance into Senior AR roles, Quality Analysts, or Team Leads. Performance is recognized, and consistent performers are rewarded with promotions and incentives.
cons: High Workload & Target Pressure The job can be demanding, especially during month-end closures or client escalations. Meeting daily call and claim targets requires strong focus and time management. Limited Work-Life Balance at Peak Times Night shifts and tight deadlines may affect personal routines, especially for those new to the healthcare BPO environment. However, this improves with experience and adaptability.

title: Omega la empresa con mas rosca
pros: En general es un buen lugar para trabajar. Lo mejor siempre serán las campañas de backoffice. que tiene omega. En general las personas son amables y los procesos de contratación son rapidos.
cons: La situación en la empresa está llegando a un punto insostenible. Lo más grave es que, a pesar de la cantidad de personas que se siguen contratando, las condiciones laborales no mejoran, sino que empeoran. El espacio para almorzar es insufrible, con mesas apretadas como si estuviéramos en un comedor comunitario. Los casilleros ni siquiera dan abasto, pero parece que seguirán contratando gente sin pensar en cómo organizar este caos. Estos problemas, aunque molestos, son menores en comparación con lo que realmente está dañando el ambiente: la falta de transparencia y el favoritismo descarado en los procesos de selección y promoción. Las convocatorias para cargos como QA, supervisores y demás son una farsa. La realidad es que ya tienen a alguien “de antemano” para esos puestos. Las promociones no se dan por méritos, sino por conexiones personales. El que sube es el que es amigo del jefe, el que le cae bien, el que tiene algún vínculo cercano, o incluso el que adula para conseguir favores. Pero en fin, call center no?

title: Truth behind Omega
pros: Handsome Salary and incentives will be credited as per your performance and based on the project you work for an experienced candidate Since it is a big company there is a scope of learning new things about the RCM cycle and the business side of it for freshers. For freshers a year or two it is preferable to work, you will get to know how a corporate exactly works, you will accept the fact this is how it work and you will be trained for the future.
cons: Whatever Salary you make, Either fresher or experienced. If your target is not finished, management will make sure you finish it whatever concern or difficulty you have ( based on project only) If you are interested in learning the process, there is a scope of learning but you won't have leisure time. They have the worst cafeteria, apart from water nothing will be there. At certain time every employee will rush to get the snacks they provide which is token based. It will be good but it can be made better

No projects / no business Unequal treatment False promises Poor management Worst HR's HR will contact someone else, who is working from quite long time to get the HR related information or to passon the information to your team, but they will not directly contact you for your team. Welcome to Omega healthcare. Do not join this company at the Team Lead level or above if you care about your career.

title: About omega healthcare
pros: Growth Opportunities: The company often provides opportunities for career advancement, especially for those with strong performance and a willingness to learn. * Exposure to Healthcare Industry: Working at Omega can expose you to the healthcare industry and its processes, which can be valuable for career development. * Competitive Compensation: Omega generally offers competitive salaries and benefits packages to its employees. * Collaborative Environment: Many employees report a positive work culture with collaborative teams and supportive colleagues. * Training and Development: The company may provide training programs to help employees develop their skills and knowledge.
cons: * High Workload: Like many BPO companies, Omega can have demanding workloads and tight deadlines, which may lead to work-life balance challenges. * Shift Work: Depending on the role, employees might be required to work shifts, which can disrupt personal life and routines. * Limited Job Security: The BPO industry can be volatile, and job security may be affected by factors such as economic conditions and client needs. * Potential for Burnout: The combination of high workload, shift work, and the nature of the healthcare industry can contribute to burnout if not managed effectively. * Bureaucracy: Some employees have mentioned that the company's organizational structure can be bureaucratic, leading to slower decision-making processes.

title: My review
pros: Training is excellent and relevant.
cons: Stagnation due to age-bound promotion policy which requires employees to complete 2 years for being eligible for promotion at every level. Very slow and stagnated growth due to this. No support for employee knowledge enhancement as there is no sponsored certification program. Support functions like Admin and Information Technology are mostly arrogant. Some of the Admin managers and executives are behaving very rudely. IT engineers are making their own rules for providing support while these rules or policies are not being mentioned anywhere. IT infrastructure is also very primitive. Compliance Team tends to block even the most genuine and most necessary websites. There is no support from the Back to Office (B2O) team in the Night shifts while every request their approvals are required. The overall response of these teams is pathetic and it causes inordinate delays. The HR policies are not employee friendly. The employees are not given reasonable time to apply for their leaves or absences after the payroll period is completed.

title: Competitive salary, but certainly no work-life balance.
pros: - Competitive salary compared to other companies. - Training is detailed. - Incentives for being top performer.
cons: - Unrealistic quotas. Need to complete at least 18 prior authorization requests per shift, but there's also a call hold rule to wait for 3 hours for a single call made to payer. Each case has a minimum of 4 calls to process not to mention the call drops/disconnects wherein you need to redial. - Different QAs, different standards. You pass or fail depending on how the QA analyzes the case - no matter how much effort you put into working a single case. - A lot of agents tend to go after quantity instead of quality. You'll even see updates on notes indicating only a single "." and "call disconnected" multiple times even when no call was made, and yet supervisors still tolerate behaviors like these. - High turnover rate. - A lot of tenured peeps also chooses the case they want to process leaving newbies with the most complicated ones. - It appears like QA and Training Team work together against Prod. You will get confused who you should follow in processing the case. - No support system. You're on your own unless your team lead is generous enough to help you. - COE and backpay too a long time to be released (literally more than a year after separation from the company) despite completeness of documentation provided. They will not process it unless you follow it up daily.

And they said they will not continue with me. The worst part is they did not provide me any system to update my attendance. After 75 day from my last working day I got my FNF payment. That was also with 29 days LOP. When I told them that I don't have any system to update my attendance. Then how can I update my attendance. They told me that whether you have a system or not it is your responsibility to update attendance. And they didn't pay for those days. I strongly recommend my friends to not to join Omega healthcare because of the management.

title: Giving 1* because I am not able to give 0*. It would stand in the top for the Top Worst companies. Cheap MNC!
pros: The only 'Pro's' I can mention is that you will receive you salary on time.
cons: Too many to explain! Racism! Bucketism! Goonism! Want a promotion? You have to butter n bucket. Or convert yourself to a beautiful girl. Want a Holiday? Work an extra day! Want any benefits? Well.....I haven't seen any benefits or perks in the company. Shift allowances? Does it even exist in the company? Work environment? Old systems that is even slower than your Granny! Fun activities? Omg! Just forget about it! They just do it for namesake. Any advantages? Well you can while away your time if you can hold a bucket. Bigger the bucket, more timepass. Work life balance? What is that? And the worst thing of all is, higher management talk in regional languages if they don't want you let you know what they are speaking off.

title: Good training for Freshers but have work pressure
pros: Good learning and training Good work experience becz here we do work more than we can by daily basis Monthly assessment for learning Supportive team leads ( not sure about all) Get up-to-date coding updates Increase in quality
cons: Poor salary for freshers compare to other branches( 9,400 for a month it is hard to continue with this salary Many trainees are resigning after 2 or 3 month production because of low salary , work Pressure, Daily work extending ( 8 to 6 is shift but due to heavy work extending upto 10pm ) not getting a social lyf , not able to participate in family life For wfh this salary is able to satisfy if this continues after coming office can't able to do daily expenses Im from other state so need accommodation food and travel expenses so for me 9 k not enough

title: Executive-RCM
pros: A good start for a fresher who want to pursue a career in healthcare industry. Strong general foundation about healthcare during the course of training. After training you will be on the floor based on a ramp up and will be learning more about the process/project during the ramp up period but depend on to which process/project you are assigned to which is solely based upon on the performance during the course of training.
cons: Less salary package for freshere but pays lot for experience. A bond for 1 year for fresher surrendering original certificate incase if you did not complete you have to pay inorder to get it back either by deducting from your salary. Lots of Extension shifts and even during the weekend but depending on the process. Inbalance the amount of effort and hard work you put does not show the output on the payslip. Think employee are machines.

title: Team lead at Bangalore, worked for around 8 years at Omega bcz of passion I had towards my job & my company😊
pros: Our batch was the first batch to start the operations in full fledge where omega was initially associated with Manipal group. I'm really proud for it to have a wonderful & long career in my life
cons: Even with huge workloads i learnt to balance it in appropriate manner, my subordinates & my superior were always supportive in ups & downs of professional. Learnt people managing in my early days in Omega. I hd a rocking & fantastic team, Great to see omega growing rapidly from where it was 10 years down the line as an outsider now. Even I changed my domain completely now bt still im what is bcz of Omega.

title: Tough Job
pros: A lot of support from teammates and leads, but their coding, requires good understanding of medical concepts and documents. Lower salary than other companies Currently WFH due to the pandemic; they will provide the computer if needed Good healthcare/insurance Quick promotion opportunities
cons: Heavy workload for coders leads and coaches You will still have work on some holidays Overtime pay only applies for coders if they're coding more than what is normal Quick employee turnover which means you'll be dealing with/training new employees almost constantly Upper management is very distant, you will always be compared to the main branch which has high production rates, but poorer quality Some employees in higher positions take advantage of the WFH setup to avoid work or dump work onto others

title: Omega Healthcare has a good environment with HR management but for freshers its not an good opening for them.
pros: The transportation team is good in omega. The process team leader is good which i have worked. The complain which raised in HR management will be proceed ASAP.
cons: The cafeteria is very small comparing with the company which always remains over crowded when ever we go during the breaks timing. There is overall 4-5 companies in single building which is avenue 2 and the elevator which we are using is over crowded and it will take more than 20mins to reach the propective floor. The salary for fresher is very low comparing with other companies.

title: Would recommend this company to freshers as the training and induction program here is very good!!
pros: Co-ordination between team members and team-work is good. Very satisfied with the collegues, work environment and management. Training and induction program is very good, hence I would recommend this company to freshers who would like to start a career in Medical Coding.
cons: No time to dedicate for yourself as the work load is more, thus employees end up working on weekends (of course overtime work is paid) . Getting leaves (sick/casual) is difficult as workforce is always required on all working days to clear the backlog work.

title: Learn bucketing if you really want growth in this company because hard work is useless here

cons: No support from management and they is nothing called as honesty here Every single day extending Partiality is too much here My TL was selfish never cared if anyone is sick in the team or has some issues, he was like a black gorilla who doesn't understand human language, Managers are always sleeping It is really good company but people are misusing the authority given to them. Please don't join here or else you I'll regret

title: working attributes in omega

title: It doesn't matter if you are a good worker here. All that matters is are you a good chamcha(one who buckets).
pros: Job is very interesting and HR department is one of the best.
cons: TL n Managers are worst, how can they even get selected as TL when they know nothing about the job. You bucket them then you are the best performer in the team!!!. Salary is less!!. Teammates are nothing but spies hired by your TL and Managers!!!!. Target is nothing but you just have to climb mount everest everyday, simple isn't it??!!. You have to work 10-12 hrs a day just to reach half of the given target!!!. You'll be forced to work on weekends by your TLs. I would rate this as the worst company in India.

title: Stress Free Work Environment! I love it here!
pros: It's a 1 day hiring process and HR staff were very friendly and accommodating, especially Coach Wendy and Nave! I love working here because it's just a small area and we get to know each other very well! They give out attendance incentive worth 5,000php on top of your base pay, which is pretty good! They give you a healthy life balance because they wont let you get exposed and being bombarded with alot of calls. The next 6 months I was promoted as a trainer and I started as a CSR agent.
cons: None as the moment.

title: Employee attention
pros: I have to say it's good for start ups or fresher's as you can say. Especially in RCM vertical you get to learn new things everyday.
cons: The company does not give attention to an employee or his/her benefits. The main problem is extending, you need to extend if you don't acheive daily target. But this is for weekly basis.

title: Final settlement
pros: Only best thing will get salary on 1st of every month.
cons: I have worked nearly one year in this company.I have served notice period for 2months and hve returned back all gadgets.45 days after resigning they should give final settlement.But even though it's 4 months i didn't receive my final settlement ,No proper response,No proper reply for mails and calls.After these many struggle, they are replying as We have detected ur final settlement as training fees ..I have given interview and then nly i got into this job first 3 months no salary. While joining also no one said about this and while resigning also no one said. i have never seen such a company like this.Please don't ever join this company.

title: Working for this company has been a good experience for me.
pros: The management are pro-employees as a whole. They took care of their rank and file employees. The training was meticulous.
cons: The location was horrible. Going to the workplace is marred by terrible traffic (cars, people, and elevator) during rush hours. Some persons with position are simply rude and selfish.

title: Work
pros: Training was so good and even tough we didn’t cover few things once into production it really helped me a lot. The process I worked for helped me to gain a lot of experience than others from my batch.
cons: First thing I felt in my team was there’s no unity. My TL isn’t one of the most important reason to quit the job. She doesn’t know how to treat freshers. Started putting a lot of pressure rom day one itself. Even tough I’m ok with my family’s members forced me to quit the job.

title: "Unforgettable Experience - Would Like to Work Again"
pros: Omega Healthcare is a company that provides business process outsourcing (BPO) services to the healthcare industry. Here are a few reasons why someone might choose to work at Omega Healthcare: 1)Opportunities for career growth: Omega Healthcare offers a wide range of roles and opportunities for employees to advance their careers within the company. 2)Impactful work: The company's mission is to improve the healthcare experience for patients and healthcare providers. Working at Omega Healthcare means that you would be making a positive impact on the healthcare industry. 3)Training and development opportunities: Omega Healthcare invests in the growth and development of its employees, providing training and development opportunities to help them improve their skills and advance in their careers. 4)Competitive compensation and benefits: Omega Healthcare offers competitive compensation packages and benefits to its employees, including health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off. 5)Positive work culture: Omega Healthcare places a strong emphasis on employee engagement and fostering a positive work culture. The company values work-life balance and promotes a positive and supportive work environment. 6)Diverse Team : Omega Healthcare has a diverse team of employees from different countries and cultures, which can provide a unique and enriching work experience. 7)High-tech Environment: Omega Healthcare utilizes the latest technologies to improve employees' performance and provide efficient and effective services to their clients.
cons: Depends on the Job role and Project. Some Job roles are rotational, either day or night. Employees have to work overtime to reach their daily targets. Some team leaders force employees to work on weekends.

title: Omega undergoing Transformation
pros: So many actually... 1. consistent topline growth with CAGR above 20% and EBITDA above 25% - very few companies in the world achieve this year on year 2. Growth oriented in terms of domain expansion, creating newer customer based either organically or through inorganic growth strategy 3. Currently company excessively focuses on skill building, nurturing and retaining, which I believe is pro-employee 4. I would call Omega work environment as an "Orderly Chaos" ....as we grow at a fast pace, things appear to be chaotic, clumsy or excessively dynamic but trust me all in the chain are very well synced so that we are directionally aligned, there is role, responsibility and accountability clarity for everybody 5. The company has become more transparent, open to ideation and experimentation and tolerant towards accidental low performance
cons: I won't call it a demerit exactly but yes you may have to invest a lot of time on work [though work-life balance flexibility is absolutely there] because we are growing and transforming ourselves.....we need talented and committed mindsets who don't mind working round the clock with flexibility of devoting time to family anytime they want.....meaning it is your work and you better manage it well...company enables you and expects you to produce desired outcomes.....if you are a low nerve, very safe playing type and don't enjoy rollercoaster ride, then please don't join this company but if you aspire to perform and rise like a phoenix every time you are handed with audacious goals to achieve, then this is the right place......at the end it is your perspective about your life.....you want to live now in slow and safe installments so that you may have a better afterlife or you want to live to the fullest now ...YOUR DECISON

title: Its an ITES company and Not for IT people

title: Pathetic
pros: On time fixed cabs to and fro for night shift employees
cons: Lots of politics in IJP, if u start bucketing to your supervision and your Manager then you will have growth, else the pressure will be like hell if u work genuinely. No proper salary for freshers, they'll treat like dogs. In WFH culture they'll provide you a desktop and a jio dongle. If the connectivity is not good, they'll demand us to shift to good location or to get broadband connection from our pocket. My question, how can a employee with below 15k/ month can bare the broadband bills?.

title: My boat sails well. I had good career growth just in 4+ years... thank you omega and team.
pros: 1) Recognition (not that all receives though! ) frankly speaking this is why i still work here.. 2) Culture of the org 3) Nature of the job is interesting.
cons: - Forseeing event and fixing is good, but shouldn't be done immediately. - Comparatively poor compensation structure. - Management style changes frequently

title: Best company
pros: Equal opportunity --- rule is a rule for all the fools ( applicable for TM too) Decent salary package -- 16 k for fresher (inclusive of VP) Rewards and recognitions Over all I would advice freshers to step into this company for a good learning & growth opportunity.
cons: Few places where we can easily identify internal politics. But my kind advice is just like that neglect those and move on. This is how I survived, i would suggest the same.

title: Love it!
pros: Lots of Perks, Resources, Opportunities, Structure and Order, and lastly, Stability.
cons: the building (Cebu Site) is a private entity, and they priorities residential only, so employees must only enter at the back or in the basement, and not allowed to enter at the lobby/ main entrance. I think that's the only cons I can think of.

title: Wish I could give half star!!
pros: Not a single positive review!!
cons: Worst medical coding company so far in my career , Management treats employees like labor , Extract freshers to full extent, salary is too low, Even the security guards than Sr coders, Full of politics , IP- DRG is the worst - the management dont know anything about the project/process and ask the coders to code sky high targets, No emphasis on quality, No growth no future , Only degradation of own career, Daily people are ABSCONDING !! NEVER EVER SUGGEST ANYONE FOR THIS COMPANY NOR EVEN TO YOUR ENEMIES.

title: Company Review; Salary Review; Benefit review

Sometimes you may feel psychologically depressed to quit your job. Money minded management.
cons: The company is really clever. I say this because the top level managers are paid well and attractive incentive packages, so to reach their prize. They treat us like horses like in a horse riding competition like jockeys.

title: work in a variety of industries & handle a number of financial duties, from maintain

title: TOO MUCH LOAD , I need to reach UNREASONABLE targets for TL's variable pay
pros: - easy to crack interview if you have basic English - if you are good, they wont hire coz they know tht place is not for smart. only monotonous and mundane work available - GOOD CANTEEN, CHEAP PRICES. - GOOD PLACE FOR FRESHERS WHO ARE FINANCIALLY WEAK. work here and look out in parallel
cons: - If you reach office by 5 mins late, salary gets deducted. I DO SEE PEOPLE RUNNING TO OFFICE FROM A kilometer - If you won't stay in-front of machine for 8 hours, salary gets deducted - If you reach target in short, you need to come weekends. since TL's variable depends on her reporting laborers - If you take leave, you need to come weekend. then what's point in taking leave - If you ask comp off, you need to come weekend - If you fall sick, YOU MUST COME TO OFFICE. I once provided medical certificate to convince my lead - No benefits if you come on weekend - You should be in-front of machine always. They monitor with a software tool on machines - MOBILES NOT ALLOWED - unhygienic workplace, i saw bugs and cockroaches lot of times - Pathetic techpark, lots of stray dogs - People absconding by leaving their ORIGINAL certificates which they gave as collateral while joining - 1year agreement - MY MAID EARNS MORE THAN ME BY SPENDING 7-8 hours/day - pay decently as you are getting enough billings from customer. - Cab drivers, zomato delivery personnel earns 3 times more than your employees - Even after 5 years your salary wont be going beyond 45k/month - people say coding, but it is entering medical diagnosis related data as per set of predefined values - YOU WONT FEEL THAT YOU ARE DOING SOMETHING GOOD OR MEANINGFUL - HUGE TRAFFIC in evening, as shift changes and next shift person need to share same PC. So you cannot extend your working hours
